quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [waiting on Pam to be done with the microwave] Ahhhhhhhhh. [whispering loudly] I'm hungry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Movie Monday!  The only cure I know for the Monday blues is... Varsity Blues!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Let's gooooo! Let's go, let's go, let's go!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [directing people to their assigned seats] Take a seat down there.  Second from the end.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Alright, everybody here?  Yes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [walking in with a tray of six popcorn bags] Popcorn anyone?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes pleeeeease!  Thank yooouuu!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [with five popcorn bags left] Anyone else?  Nooo.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Movie Monday started with training videos, but we went through those pretty fast.  Then we watched a medical video.  Since then, it's been half hour installments of various movies, with the exception of an episode of Entourage, which Michael made us watch six times.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Entourage!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Kevin, would you like to do the scenes from last week?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Why him?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Don't whine.  Get the window. [Dwight exhales]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Previously on Varsity Blues...

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Ok.  Billy-Bob, got a head injury, but coach made him play.  So then Lance, he gets sacked, he's out for the year...

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: [walking into an empty office because everyone is watching Varsity Blues] Hello?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Not everyone approves of Movie Monday.  I won't say who.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I don't approve.  I don't.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Hello? [Angela coughs and points to the conference room]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [Jan walks in on Movie Monday] Hi Jan!  Hope you brought the Milk Duds!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: How would a movie increase productivity Michael?  How on earth would it do that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: People work faster after...

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Magically?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No... they have to... to make up for the time they lost watching the movie.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: [walking past Dwight's desk] Kitchen.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Michael is going to get us all fired.  You sat back and let him play that dumb movie, and now Jan is peeved off and we're all going to lose our jobs.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: That's not going to happen.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: You know she has it out for him now.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: That's not his fault!  He had to follow his heart!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Ever since Michael dumped Jan for Carol, Jan's been bitching out on him.  Reject a woman and she will never let it go.  One of the many defects of their kind.  Also weak arms.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Dwight, you should be running this office.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Michael would never let me...

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: It's not up to Michael, it's Jan's call. Talk to her.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I could never do that!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Fine!  Sit back and do nothing and let us all get fired!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I know that patience and loyalty are good, and virtuous traits.  But sometimes I just think you need to grow a pair.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: At the Stamford branch, they all play this World War II video game called Call of Duty, and they're all really into it.  I'm told it started as a team building exercise.  Unfortunately I really suck at it.  We didn't play many video games in Scranton.  Instead we'd do stuff like, uh, Pam and I would sometimes hum the same high pitched note, and try to get Dwight to make an appointment with an ear doctor.  And uh, Pam called it... Pretendenitus.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [on the phone] Hey Kelly, my stuff just got here. [Kelly screams with excitement into the phone and Pam has to take it away from her ear]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Kelly really likes to online shop.  Soooo, I felt like I wanted some new clothes.  I mean, I just, I wanted to, it just, I felt like it was time, to maybe um... just get new clothes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [pulling her new shirt out of a box] Ok.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: [gasps] I love it!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Really?  I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: You haven't even tried it on yet, try it on.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Not at work, I'll try it on---

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Fashion show!  Fashion show!  Fashion show at lunch!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: ...noooo

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: [clapping her hands in unison] Fashion show!  Fashion show!  Fashion show at lunch!  Fashion show!  Fashion show!  Fashion show at lunch!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Why did you do that?!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I'm just killing Germans, any way I can.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: We're on the German team.  Shoot the Brittish.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [turning around to Karen] Wait, are we playing teams?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: [laughing] Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [outside in the parking lot, pacing back and forth] WAH!  GAH!  [breathing heavily]

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: [answering the phone] Hello?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Is this Jan?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Who is this?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: This is Dwight Schrute.  I am calling about an extremely sensitive matter.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: You should talk to Michael, and he'll talk to me, and that way we don't have to speak to each other.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: It's about Michael.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: What about him?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [exhales] I can't talk here.  It's too sensitive.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: It's not about a surprise party is it?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No, but we should discuss that another time.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Look, I am already an hour outside of Scranton, Dwight, I'm not coming back.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Pull over at exit 40.  There is a Liz Claiborne outlet.  I know you like that store.  Go inside and shop, until I can meet you.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: How do you know I like that store?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Many of your blouses are Claiborne's.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: How do you know that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Part of my job.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: No it's not.  It's officially not.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: ...noted.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [walking into Michael's office] I'm going... to the dentist.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I have to have an emergency crown put in.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ouchy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yes.  It's a new dentist.  He's far.  I might be gone... three hours.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Three hours, wow.  Have fun.  [Dwight walks away staring through the blinds at Michael]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Did you get anything good?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: New blouse?  Halter top?  Camisole?  Teddy?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I can save the branch.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Really?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: If you let me run it.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [excitedly] "Ok" I can run it?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: What would you do differently?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Mostly get rid of waste.  Which is half the people there.  And clean house.  [to waitress in diner]  Right here.  It's all for me.  Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Dwight, you must feel strongly, to speak with me this way, behind Michael's back, and turn on so many of your co-workers.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: The decision to turn on Michael was difficult.  [pouring way too much syrup on his food] But once I did it, I didn't look back.  And mostly I feel that Michael would approve.  It's really what's best for the branch.  And I could care less about my co-workers.  So [cutting his food, giving Jan a "so there" look], here we are.  It's all, on the table.  I want... the branch.  And I await your decision.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [shoveling waffles into his mouth] Oh, by the way.  There's a new Ann Taylor outlet store near here.  I know you like their earrings.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: [thinks for a second] Where is it?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: [on speakerphone with Michael] Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: I just had a very interesting conversation with one of your employees.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh.  That's nice.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: No, it wasn't.  Dwight just told me that he thinks he can run the branch better than you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: ...what?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: ...you were at the dentist?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: You can't have people undermining you.  Get control of your branch immediately.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: What was Dwight thinking?  That he could turn Jan against me?  She's my ex-lover!  ...ish.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: [Pam walks out of the bathroom wearing her new red shirt] Woooooow.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: It's so sexy.  You look so hot.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: It's really something.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [smiling] It's too much.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I'm gonna return it.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: No, you have to keep it today, just see how you feel.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.line: [walking into the break room] Hey.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.line: You look nice.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Isn't that like your third soda today?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeah I think we can be a big help to your company.  [someone dims the lights, signifying that it's game time]  Ok, see you next week.  Bye.  [to Karen] Again?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Scared?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: [with her hands making the rocker sign] Call of Duty!

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.line: [sounding upset] Andy, Jim, can I see you in the conference room for a minute?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Now?

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.line: Yes now.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Put the game on hold everyone.

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.line: This is not working, ok?  We are getting slaughtered out there.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: It's the new guy. [looks at Jim]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, I'm sorry I don't know... what we're talking about...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: See what I mean?

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.line: We just need a strategy, ok?  We're going to set up a trap in the gun room.  All right Jim, are you using the MP-40 or the 44?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Um, sniper rifle?

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.line: SNIPE--

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: WHAT?

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.line: JIM!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Are you playing for the other team?!

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.line: You don't snipe in Carrington, ok?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Saboteur!

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.line: Andy, it's not---

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Saboteur!  I'm going to kill you for real.  This game--- the game is over.  I'm really going to shoot you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Do you want an M&M?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No thanks I'm stuffed.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No seriously.  You should have an M&M, they're really good.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: ...ok. [takes and eats several M&M's]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: They're good, huh?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: ...so good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey.  I thought you weren't supposed to eat anything for a couple hours after you've had a crown put in.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: They have this new kind of quick drying bonding, so...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Sounds like a good dentist.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: What's his name?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [long pause] Crentist.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Your dentist's name is Crentist.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Huh.  Sounds a lot like dentist.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Maybe that's why he became a dentist.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Let me see your teeth.  Let me see 'em.  Let me see 'em.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [reluctantly opens his mouth and Michael peers inside]  Ahh.  Aaaah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You should... floss.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I know...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [exhales] Well then... I am glad you're ok.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Business is like a jungle.  And I... am like a tiger.  And Dwight, is like a monkey, that stabs the tiger in the back with a stick.  Does the tiger fire the monkey?  Does the tiger transfer the monkey to another branch?  [smiling] Pun.  There is no way of knowing what goes on inside the tiger's head.  We don't have the technology.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Dwight, can I talk to you for a second?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [in Michael's office] Wow, this is tough.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ohhhh.  Arrrgggh!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What is it?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well, I just got off the phone with Jan.  And um... she demoted me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah. You know what the craziest part of this is? She demoted me to your job!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Gahh!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: And she said that you should be expecting a call later from corporate, and that um, I guess that means that you are going to be acting manager of Dunder Mifflin, Scranton.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I can't believe this news.  That--- wow.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I know.  I told her I didn't know whether you'd wanna do it... because you've always been so loyal to me.  You've been my most trusted ally.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You said that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yep, I did.  I did.  But I think... you should do it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Well... Gosh, if you think I should.  Then I will.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [exhales] Perfect, well, we're settled.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: All right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: All right.  Well then, you are now acting manager of Dunder Mifflin Scranton Branch, and I... am assistant regional manager.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Assistant to the regional manager.  Thank you Michael, for staying on.   I really appreciate it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ohh..

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Hey... I can't imagine this place without you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [muttering] Can't you?  That's so nice.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well... I guess we should go tell the troops.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yeah, when I'm ready, Mike. [Dwight exhales, Michael looks at the camera] Ok let's do it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey, hi, hello.  Everybody, I have some good news, and I have some bad news.  I... am being replaced, as your leader, by Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: You're kidding...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You might think that I am kidding, and I understand that.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Congratulations Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Thank you Angela.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: But... why Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Because, Dwight... never lies.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: How does that qualify him to run a branch?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Because that's all it takes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ok, Dwight, would you like to say a few words to everybody... about loyalty?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Thank you Michael.  I just want to say, to the few of you who will remain under my employ, that I intend to lead you into the black!  With ferocity!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Michael, what will you do?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, I'll be fine.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Do you have any savings?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, no, I don't, but---

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Michael, you might lose your condo.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I... won't.   I won't.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I have this little vacuum cleaner that's broken.  If Dwight doesn't work out, maybe that could be manager.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Maybe I'll quit.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: It's really happening!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: We can make a difference here.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I, will, make a difference here.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: You alone?  Because I thought together we could---

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh please, don't be naive.  But you can be in charge of the women.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: [whispering] Look how cute he is!  He's trying to shoot with a smoke grenade.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I'm sorry what are you whispering about?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: I'm sorry nothing, just concentrate on turning around.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I'm trying---

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Just tap S then D.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: [her players gun is pointed directly at Jim's player's head] Any... last words?  No?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: What? [Karen's player shoots Jim's player, "You killed Jim Halpert" appears on the screen, Karen giggles]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Wow. Psychopath.  [Karen grins widely at Jim]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: I'm just looking.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Please go back to your desk.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: In a minute.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Well, I remember why I dress the way I do at work.  But I'm gonna keep the clothes.  I mean, it'll be cool to just have some after work clothes that aren't pajamas.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well, I guess it's time, that I turn over the keys, to the famous Sebring.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [smiling] No thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: It's a corporate lease Dwight, you've earned it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No thanks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Not my style.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: But you said you liked it.  You've always admired it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Well that was before.  I'm thinking about getting something German, something with decent gas mileage.  Plus, that convertible, it's a ridiculous choice for this climate.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [Michael finally breaks] Take it back.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [confused] No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: That's my car.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What did you---

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: THAT'S MY CAR.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I know, Dwight.  I know.  I know.  I know.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You know what?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Jan called me about your little meeting!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I know, what you did.  I made the whole thing up, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I think the Sebring's cool.  It's cool.  The Seabring's cool.  It has a cassette and it has a CD.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh do you?  Do you like the Sebring--- HOW DARE YOU?!  How dare you, Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [Dwight gets on his knees and puts his face down on the ground] Don't fire me.  Please.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Give me one good reason why I should fire you RIGHT HERE ON THE SPOT?!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [terrified] I HAVE EXCELLENT SALES NUMBERS!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Not.  Good.  Enough!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [sobbing] I'll do anything!  Anything!  I'll do your laundry for a month!  For a year!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I have a laundry machine!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I'm sorry!  I'll do anything, I swear. [squeaking, crying]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I don't know if I can trust you anymore.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You can't.  You can't.  But I promise I'll never betray you again.  What can I do, Michael.  What can I do?  [Michael exhales]  What can I do?  [Dwight has his face to the ground but his butt raised high in the air] What can I do?  What can I do?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You can get up.  Get up. [Dwight gets up with spit hanging from his lips] And you can hug it out, bitch.  [Dwight and Michael have a firm embrace]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hug it out, bitch.  That is what men say to each other, after a fight.  They hug it out, and doing so, the just... let it go.  And walk away.  And they're done.  Not a good idea to say that to a woman however.  I have found.  It doesn't translate.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [leaving his desk for the day, pretends pull the pen out of a pretend grenade, and tosses it to Karen]

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: [throws some desk material in the air to signify debris from the grenade explosion, grins as Jim walks away]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yep.  Yeah, we hugged it out.  But, it turns out, I was still a little angry.  So, I felt I needed to punish him, just a little bit more, [cut to Dwight standing on a box with "LIAR" written on a piece of paper hung around his neck, Dwight's head hung in shame] and I'm making him do my laundry for a year.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay. [Jan leaves Michael's office; Dwight enters]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Hey. [shuts door] Is everything okay?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: It is not your business, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: If the branch is in trouble, there are things you can do.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: What do you know about management, Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I know that we need to cut costs.  We could fire Meredith. That's a big cost.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I'm not firing anyone.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Creed might be living here, we could charge him rent.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: ... What?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: Four nights a week, I sleep under my desk, and then three nights I stay at my place in Toronto. They don't know about this job up there. It's a welfare state. Beautiful countries, both of 'em.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay. Here we go. Everybody, you know what? It dawned on me we were all in there watching a movie together before we were so rudely interrupted, Let's get back in there. [no takers] Come on. Movie Monday! Come on, Stanley let's go.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: [standing at the supply shelf] I'm on the phone.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ryan?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: I'm pretty sure Jan said that we're not supposed to.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay, well, we had scheduled this time to watch a movie together, so I guess I will just go play some online Scrabble.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [looks to Angela]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: [shakes her head disapprovingly]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: The Schrutes are a very loyal breed. But I also have Mannheim blood from my German grandmother. And the Mannheims knew when to cut and run. No sense going down with a losing regime. But the Schrute blood... It's amazing that when these two bloods mix, the whole thing didn't explode.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: So, she sleeps with him, but she is still in love with the head surgeon, um, the McDreamy guy, and she starts crying, but the dorky doctor, he's in love with her... [phone rings]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Dunder Mifflin, this is Pam. ... Uh, sure, I'll get him for you. [to Michael] It's Jan for you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Really?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I may have a few weeks ago faked a call from Jan in order to get out of a synopsis of, I think it was, Navy: NCIS. Since then, Michael's been suspicious.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Nnnnice. Wow!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [playing Call of Duty] Oh? Someone's left out in the open, taking a little siesta. Not smart. [shoots] Yes! Finally killed you... [Karen's desk is empty]

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Hey, Jim?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hey, Jan.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: How's work going?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [nervously] Pretty good.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: [kills Jim's character, giggles] Oh, you know what, I gotta see Josh right now, but remind me to tell you what Dwight said to me earlier, okay? You'll get a big kick out of it. [leaves]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [baffled expression]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Things are a little bit... different here in Stamford. [shrug] It's not bad.
